goals__remit: The Federation of European Securities Exchanges (FESE) represents 33 exchanges in equities, bonds, derivatives and commodities through 18 Full Members from 27 countries, as well as 1 Affiliate Member and 1 Observer Member. FESE is a keen defender of the Internal Market and many of its members have become multi-jurisdictional exchanges, providing market access across multiple investor communities. FESE represents public Regulated Markets. Regulated Markets provide both institutional and retail investors with transparent and neutral price-formation. Securities admitted to trading on our markets have to comply with stringent initial and ongoing disclosure requirements and accounting and auditing standards imposed by EU laws.
relevant_communication:
Drafting position papers on the European Commission proposals. 
Organising of policy events on specific Commission proposals.
